code_changes.description: Simple JSON read/write for handoffs between agents

commits.message: feat: Implement TODO-based handoffs between PLANNING agents
docs: Update CLAUDE.md with TODO-based handoffs status
docs: Add TODO-based handoffs to README architecture section
docs: Add data-driven impact assessment for TODO-handoffs

next_session_todos: Review PR description (PR_DESCRIPTION.md) and decide: merge or adjust
If merge: Create PR, get approval, merge to main
THEN: Choose next priority from impact report:
Option A: Resume flag (~50 lines, high value)
Option B: HITL approval on handoffs (~20 lines, compliance)
Option C: Extend handoffs to CODING phase (~60 lines, consistency)
Option D: Portfolio test with real project (validate system end-to-end)

context_for_next_session.system_state: Stable - all tests pass, handoffs verified working
known_issues: AUDITOR quality gate missing task files (separate system, not blocking)
pytest not installed by default (documented in CLAUDE.md)
key_decisions: Handoffs use SIMPLE JSON (no validation, no schema, no abstractions)
handoff_todos injected into agent inputs as formatted string
context_for_next_session.testing_notes: manual_planning_test.py validates full workflow, shows handoff logging works

critical_files_to_understand: CLAUDE.md - Operational truth (what works, how to verify)
TODO_HANDOFFS_IMPACT_REPORT.md - Data-driven analysis of what changed
anti_patterns_to_avoid: DO NOT add validation/schema to handoffs (keep it simple)
DO NOT create HandoffManager class (no abstractions)
DO NOT batch multiple handoffs in one file (one file per transition)
DO NOT trust docs without running verification commands
